snippet: On visits home to his family, our Raphael Minder writes, he saw changes that those living in the famously safe and somewhat sleepy Swiss city were slower to notice, in particular the increase in crime.
abstract: On visits home to his family, our Raphael Minder writes, he saw changes that those living in the famously safe and somewhat sleepy Swiss city were slower to notice, in particular the increase in crime.
lead_paragraph: English-speaking newspapers, in contrast to their French or German counterparts, tend to rotate their correspondents after a few years. Part of the thinking is that though a long-standing journalist has greater knowledge and contacts, he or she might lack fresh eyes.
